sentence: The tech sector is the undisputed market favorite right now.
Not only is the sector up by over 30% so far this year, but it has also leapt from 16% of the S&P 500® index to the current weighting of just over 23%.

We wanted to take advantage of the latest addition to the Nasdaq Smart Portfolio’s Crowd Insights page - the ability to compare your portfolio picks to the best-performing Nasdaq portfolios - and find the three most popular tech stock picks right now.'
As you can see from the screenshot below, we can do this by limiting the crowd insights to only top portfolios that are generating the highest returns for investors.

Now let’s dive in and take a closer look at which tech stocks the savviest Nasdaq investors are snapping up:

This social media giant is by far and away the number 1 most popular tech stock for best-performing investors on Nasdaq’s Smart Portfolio platform.
Perhaps this isn’t surprising given the fact that it is up by a whopping 56% already year-to-date.
Plus, FB’s stock analysis page on TipRanks reveals that the stock has a ‘Strong Buy’ analyst consensus rating.
With an average analyst price target of $208, analysts are predicting impressive upside potential of over 15% from the $179 current share price.
One notable FB bull is RBC Capital’s Mark Mahaney.
This five-star analyst has a very strong track record of 72% success rate and 22.7% average return per recommendation, so his ratings are carefully tracked by investors.
“We still think FB is the Best Growth Story in Tech” states Mahaney.

He is bullish about the stock’s growth potential because “FB’s current low market shares – less than 20% of Global Online Advertising & mid-single-digit % of Global Total Advertising – will help it maintain premium growth for a long time.” Add in the fact that FB still has several new large revenue growth drivers (Instagram, Messaging, Camera/AR, AI and Video) at its disposable, and you can see why this is such a promising stock right now.
On November 2, Mahaney ramped up his FB price target from $195 to $230 following “very impressive” earnings results for Q3.
And luckily for investors, his new bullish price target translates into big upside of 28% from the current share price.
For the third quarter, Facebook revealed that even more people are using its social networking site.
Monthly active users (MAU)- the key metric- is now at 2.07 billion, up 16% from the same period last year.

Crucially, more users also equals more data for FB- and as Mahaney points out, this data is a “unique and valuable asset for ad and content targeting.”

In second place comes Microsoft, the world’s largest software company by revenue.
In fact, we found that close to 5% of a top Nasdaq portfolio is invested in MSFT, which is currently trading at record highs of almost $85.
Like FB, Microsoft has a ‘Strong Buy’ analyst consensus rating which breaks down into 15 buy, 1 hold and 1 sell ratings over the last three months.
These analysts have an average price target on MSFT of $88 which, given the current record share levels, comes out at just 4% upside from the current share price.
But this limited upside is not a reason to be wary of the stock.
First, several top analysts are much more bullish than the average price target would suggest.
Take, for example, five-star Deutsche Bank analyst Karl Keirstead.
He reiterated his buy rating on November 3 while ramping up his price target from $95 to $100, an 18% upside from the current share price.
And the best part is that Kairstead has a flawless track record on MSFT with a 100% success rate and 24% average return across his 22 Microsoft recommendations.
After talking with management, he feels more optimistic on the stock and is looking for fiscal 2019 free cash flow of around $5.25 per share.
If you multiply that out 18-20 times you’re left with a price target of over $100, points out Kairstead.

Meanwhile top Oppenheimer analyst Timothy Horan gives this bullish summary of Microsoft’s current position: “MSFT is the best positioned company for enterprise cloud adoption and has proven it can execute on its hybrid cloud strategy with Azure Stack, as we see it.
The legacy business revenue has held up well, while new products drive growth.

We expect a very strong calendar 4Q given the momentum this quarter and we think margins will continue to surprise on the upside.” Since October 30, he has a $92 price target on the stock- up substantially from $80 previously.
Last but by no means least, we have another tech giant: Google parent Alphabet.
This is the third favorite tech stock for top Nasdaq investors.
GOOGL is already up by an impressive 35% year-to-date.
However, the outlook from the Street reveals that it’s not too late to join the party.
GOOGL also has a ‘Strong Buy’ top analyst consensus rating with 23 recent buy ratings and just 3 hold ratings.
The $1,1159 average analyst price target translates into 9.6% upside from the current share price.
And now Google is about to shake up the cloud sector.
The company has just announced an exciting new partnership with Salesforce.com (CRM).
Salesforce and Google now plan to integrate Google’s office software with Salesforce’s core platform while integrating Google Analytics into Salesforce’s marketing cloud software.
The companies also agreed a mutual commitment to use each other’s products in the future.
"We believe this is a major beachhead account for GOOGL, setting the stage for other 'multi cloud' initiatives and possibly win share as a result," comments B.Riley FBR analyst Sameet Sinha.
He reiterated his buy rating on November 8 with a $1,200 price target (13.4% upside potential).
The views and opinions expressed herein are the views and opinions of the author and do not necessarily reflect those of Nasdaq, Inc.
